Support the Loop: Volunteer, Shop, Donate
To sign up to volunteer, please use the Contact Us page or email OrmondScenicLoop@gmail.com
DONATE to OSLT
Your support and contributions will enable us to meet our goals and fund upcoming projects and events. Donations of any amount are appreciated!  Use the secure PayPal link below or if you prefer checks can be sent to:
Ormond Scenic Loop & Trail Corridor Management Entity, Inc.
P.O. Box 1807
Ormond Beach, Florida  32175
We are a 501(c)(3) organization - all contributions are tax deductible.
Donate Now
OSLT Merchandise by Ormond Beach T-Shirt Company
Official Merchandise of the OSLT
Show your support of the Loop with locally produced quality merchandise from the Ormond Beach T-Shirt Company!
We are please to announce that a veteran owed local company is now producing our clothing, hats and accessories as well as items for your home and office.
We are very pleased with the high quality of the materials and workmanship and we think you will be too!
https://www.ormondtshirts.com/category/ormond-scenic-loop-trail
To see samples of their products in person please visit their showroom at 1362 N US1 Highway, Suite 302 C
Please Visit Our Sponsors and Affiliates
Lagerheads Bar & Grill
Casual pub and grill located on Ocean Shore with great ocean views and cool breezes. Enjoy casual dining on the pet-friendly deck. Join us for Lunch, Happy Hour, Dinner, Drinks, and nightly live music! Open for breakfast on the weekends.
https://www.lagerheadsbarandgrill.com
2986 Ocean Shore Boulevard
Ormond Beach, FL 32176
Phone: (386) 265-1977
Monday - Thursday: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm
Friday: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm
Saturday: 8:00 am - 10:00pm - open for breakfast
Sunday: 8:00 am - 9:00 pm - open for breakfast
Beachside Resale
Welcome to Beachside Resale!
Discover your coastal chic at Beachside Resale, the ultimate treasure trove for beach lovers and savvy shoppers alike! From sun-soaked styles to ocean-inspired home décor, we’ve curated the best in pre-loved and gently used items to bring a touch of seaside elegance to your life. Enjoy our collection of vintage, modern and home decor items. We accept consignment and vendor space available. Please text or call for details.
Why Shop with Us?
Eco-Friendly Finds
: Reduce waste and refresh your style with our sustainably sourced selection.
Unique Pieces
: One-of-a-kind items you won’t find anywhere else, each with its own story.
Affordable Prices
: Get the beachside look without breaking the bank.
Casey Wealth Advisors
As residents of Ormond Beach, FL, Dennis and Beth Casey provide
financial services to successful individuals, families and businesses in
the Ormond Beach and Volusia County area. With 35 years of financial
services experience between them, helping others achieve their financial
goals and dreams is their daily and long-term focus.
https://www.raymondjames.com/caseywealthadvisors
555 W Granada Blvd, Ste G-1, Ormond Beach, FL 32174-9407
386.256.4014
Anytime Mobile Notary
Anytime Mobile Notary by Cheryl
In The Daytona Beach Area
Serving 1 Hr Or Less Notary Services
Servicing all of Edgewater New Smyrna Beach Ponce Inlet and surrounding areas. 24 Hours Mobile Unit 7 days a week.
(386) 295-7747
- For Appointment Only
Personal services include Travel to FedEx and UPS. Also, Copy and print services, travel to the courthouse to drop off marriage certificates, and more.
Melody Lopez Aloha Realty
Melody Lopez
Aloha Realty of Florida
352-250-3529
aloharealty22@gmail.com
The "Real" Estate Brokerage that treats you like "family".
Aloha
Friends of  GR FROGERS
The Friends of Gamble Rogers State Park (FROGRS) is a 501c3 non-profit Citizen Support Organization. We support both Gamble Rogers and North Peninsula /State Parks through volunteering, fundraising and sponsoring programs and projects.  Both our state parks offer wonderful recreational and educational opportunities for everyone!
From member's only events to community outreach to resource management and so much more, Friends group members provide continuous support and are vital to the success of the park.  Funds raised by the Friends are used for specific projects in the park and to purchase equipment for staff and park use. Visit us at
https://www.frogrs.com/

OSLT EVENTS
See the Ormond Scenic Loop & Trail Volunteers in Action!
Our Volunteers really make a difference, and you can too!
We have several opportunities to help the Loop
Tomoka butterfly and native plant garden
Invasive plant removal
Roadway clean-up
Administrative Tasks
Leading trail walks, and educational workshops
Working our booth at the Ormond Beach Farmers Market and other special events
For more information on volunteer opportunities, please use our Contact Us page or email
OrmondScenicLoop@gmail.com
OSLT Community Events
Ormond Beach Farmers Market 3rd Thurs each Month
Ormond Beach Farmers Market
Returning:
September 18th, 2025
Please join us on the 3rd Thursday of
September
at the Ormond Beach Farmers Market!
Time:
8 am - 1 pm
Where:
30 S. Beach St, Ormond Beach, FL
After a short summer break, we will be back with information about the Loop, other non-profit organizations, fishing and wildlife, and OSLT merchandise. Freebie for the kids!
To lean about volunteering at the Market or other Community events please email us at
OrmondScenicLoop@gmail.com
If you're interested in volunteering please email us at
OrmondScenicLoop@gmail.com
ReGrow the Loop 2025
ReGrow the Loop 2025 presented  27 excellent programs and events - aimed at educating residents about the value of embracing native plants, understanding and helping to preserve our environment, planting free native trees, and learning about the wildlife living along the Loop which were held between January and May of 2025.
Special thanks to Nancy Galdo for organizing and leading ReGrow the Loop 2025 and to the following  partners who came together to make it a huge success.
Ormond Scenic Loop & Trail, Papaw Chapter of Florida Native Plant Society, Dream Green Volusia, Halifax River Audubon, Tomoka State Parks, UF/IFAS, City of Ormond Beach and Volusia County
Riverfest Seafood Festival November 16-17, 2024
We had a great time at Riverfest. Many people stopped by our tent, picked up information, and signed up to volunteer and receive our newsletter. The fishing and ring toss games were a big hit with the kids, and each child received a small prize after playing. We gave out over 200 toys purchased with a donation from Walmart Supercenter on Granada.
National Night Out - OBPD October 20,2024
OBPD National Night Out, Free Family Fun!
OSLT was an exhibitor at this event  In addition to information about the Loop, we had crafts, fishing and ring toss games for the kids with a small prize for each child.
The children had a great time and appreciated the Play-Doh, bubbles, and candy Walmart donated.by Walmart Supercenter on Granada.
Frenchman's Field Nature Hike May 11, 2024
OSLT "FRENCHMAN'S FIELD" NATURE TRAIL WALK
The newest trail on the Loop, this one and a-half mile hike traverses through an upland hardwood forest parallel to the Old Dixie Highway.   We had about 15 people join us on the hike. Our guide, Paul Rebmann taught us about the plants along the 2-mile trail.
New Native Plant Garden at Tomoka State Park  Feb 2024
New Native Plant Garden at Tomoka State Park
Twelve volunteers worked hard to get numerous plants in  the ground and clean up the garden.   Groups represented include Pawpaw chapter of the Native Plant Society,
O
SLT
, Tillandsia Garden Club, Friends of Tomoka, Tomoka volunteers, Ranger David Jones and UF/IFAS
OSLT CleanUp Crew in Action!
Highbridge Road during Bridge/Road Closing  4-26-25
The C.a.R.E. team, Laura Ureta, Don Spence and Georgann Meadows surveyed the condition of our trees along an area that is difficult to access under normal times. And six members of the CleanUp Crew picked up over 800 pounds of trash during the weekend, mostly beer bottles and cans along the area from Walter Boardman to Cobb's Corner. The CleanUp Crew was Alicia Oktar, Sonja Lehto, Denise Caruso, Melody Lopez, Bryce Merritt and Nancy Galdo
Walter Boardman Road 02-01-25
Thanks to all the 22 volunteers who showed up! Over 400 lbs. of trash were picked up along the highway.
Old Dixie Highway 12-7-24
Nine people came out to pick up trash along Old Dixie Highway in the Ormond Tomb Park area. A big thank you to Ken Battan, Alicia Oktar, Sonya Lehto and her son Harley, Maureen Pearson, Laura Ureta, Bryce Merritt, Alan Pillar, and Karen Pillar for joining us! We picked up 8 big trash bags, including lots of bottles and cans, a large piece of bubble wrap, several empty large plastic mulch bags, various smaller pieces of plastic, food wrappers, a few big plastic mulch bags, and a pesticide sprayer. Also, a motorcycle part, a large heavy metal tube, and a few car parts. We estimate at least 400 pounds in total. One of the treasures found was this nearly complete wild boar's skull.
Beach Post Hurricane 10-15-24
Our small group picked up a lot of plastic that had washed in with the seaweed although not as much as I was expecting as someone had been there before us and collected 2 big trash bags that they left on the walkover. We were also rewarded with some cool treasures from the sea.
Int'l Coastal CleanUp 2024
The kick-off event for our CleanUp Crew!
Join Us!
OSLT CleanUp Crew Events - to join us please use our Contact Us page or email
OSLTCleanUpCrew@gmail.com
